      • compare

        public static int compare(Object object1,
          Object object2,
          boolean isNullGreatest)
        Compares the given object1 and object2 without throwing any errors.
        Parameters:
        isNullGreatest - If null is considered to be greater than any other value.
        Returns:
        A negative integer, zero, or a positive integer, depending on whether the given object1 is less than, equal to, or greater than the given object2. If the parameters aren't comparable, this method always returns -1.

      • compareTo

        @Deprecated
public static int compareTo(Object object1,
                       Object object2)
        Deprecated. Use compare(java.lang.Object, java.lang.Object, boolean) instead.
        Compares the given object1 and object2.
        Returns:
        A negative integer, zero, or a positive integer, depending on whether the given object1 is less than, equal to, or greater than the given object2.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the parameters aren't comparable or compatible with each other.
        NullPointerException - If one or more parameters are null.

      • getValue

        @Deprecated
public static Object getValue(Object object,
                         String name)
        Deprecated. No replacement.
        Returns a value using any fields or methods with the given name from the given object. The order of priority for values returned (if more than one are defined) is: - actual method name - getter method "getname" - field name - underscore "_name" field name Can return value from private methods, but not private fields
